B1 [ before noun ] The following day, morning, etc. is the next one.
Examples
The following programme contains scenes that may be disturbing to some viewers.The full extent of the damage only became evident the following morning.Fair weather was forecast for the following day.They arranged to have dinner the following month.We arrive in Paris on the Sunday, and leave the following Wednesday.

following wind UK
a wind that is blowing in the same direction as the one in which you are going: Thanks to a following wind, we arrived in Madrid fifteen minutes early.
